summary: The provided text from the 'Final Guidelines on Accounting for Expected Credit Losses' explains the rationale and scope of application for the guidelines by detailing the extent to which IFRS standards are used by credit institutions in the EU. This text is descriptive and provides background context rather than imposing specific, operative legal obligations, rights, or thresholds on any actor. As this type of content (legislative rationale, purpose statements) is explicitly excluded from comparison unless it has concrete legal effects, no valid overlaps or contradictions could be identified with the related content, which primarily contains specific rules and requirements.
